cards.name: The Dark Young Stir...
cards.text: Forced - When a card instructs you to reveal a fury token, the active investigator reveals a random token from the fury bag. Then, depending on the token drawn, each Towering Dark Young makes an immediate attack against each investigator at the location... - [skull] - ...directly above them. - [cultist] - ...directly below them. - [tablet] - ...directly to the left of them. - [elder_thing] - ...directly to the right of them. - - Immediately reveal two additional fury tokens. After resolving this effect, return each fury token to the fury bag.

cards.name: Hidden in Plain Sight
cards.text:
At first, it seems like this prisoner is unguarded, but the shimmer of illusory magic sparks up as you approach. You won't be able to rescue them until you can determine a way past the illusion.
[action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). This test gets +1 [per_investigator] difficulty. When you initiate this test, investigators at your location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group to automatically succeed. If you succeed, flip this card and move it to the victory display. If you fail, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp.  Can you find your way
safely to them?
cards.name: Kidnapped Citizen
cards.text: [free] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

cards.name: Under Lock and Key
cards.text:
The circus has taken no chances, and has imprisoned this captive in an iron cage on top of their restraints. The lock for the cage is thankfully in poor condition, and can possibly be broken or jimmied open.
[action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (3). This test gets +1 [per_investigator] difficulty. When you initiate this test, investigators at your location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group to automatically succeed. If you succeed, flip this card and move it to the victory display. If you fail, take 1 damage.

cards.flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp.  Can you find your way
safely to them?
cards.name: Kidnapped Citizen
cards.text: [free] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

cards.name: Cautious Jailers
cards.text:
While most of the camp sleeps, a small group stands watch over this captive. Taking on this many at once would be sure to rouse the whole camp, but maybe there's a way to distract them -- perhaps a big way.
[reaction] After a Towering Dark Young attacks an investigator at this location (even if that attack was canceled): Place 1 resource on this card. [fast] Spend 1 clue: Place 1 resource on this card. Forced - If there are 1 [per_investigator] or more resources on this card: Flip it and move it to the victory display.

cards.flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp.  Can you find your way
safely to them?
cards.name: Kidnapped Citizen
cards.text: [free] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

cards.name: Deep in the Dark
cards.text:
You've managed to locate one captive, but they're being kept inside a hovel with barely any light. You'll have to work carefully to free them, or trust that the bright moonlight will give you enough vision.
[action] Investigators at this location spend 1 clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the victory display. Reduce the amount of clues required for this action by 1 for each token sealed on a player card at this location.

cards.flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp.  Can you find your way
safely to them?
cards.name: Kidnapped Citizen
cards.text: [free] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

cards.name: Clapped in Irons
cards.text:
This captive has been locked securely in chains that have no key whatsoever. There may be a clever way to break the shackles, but you can wrest the chains from their anchors if need be.
[action] Investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the victory display. Investigators at this location may take any amount of damage as a group to reduce the amount of clues required for this action by 1 for each damage taken.

cards.flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp.  Can you find your way
safely to them?
cards.name: Kidnapped Citizen
cards.text: [free] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

cards.name: Hypnotic State
cards.text:
Already bound, this captive is still being kept in a mesmeric trance to ensure they can't escape. You can hardly drag them around without breaking the spell, but can you do that without risking your own mind?
[action] Investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the victory display. Investigators at this location may take any amount of horror as a group to reduce the amount of clues required for this action by 1 for each horror taken.

cards.flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp.  Can you find your way
safely to them?
cards.name: Kidnapped Citizen
cards.text: [free] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

cards.flavor:
The thing lashes out wildly,
not even aiming at anything nearby.
cards.name: Towering Dark Young
cards.text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you: Test [agility] (0).  For each point you succeed by, reduce the damage dealt by this attack by 1.

cards.flavor:
Focused on the blood-red moon,
the thing howls balefully into the night.
cards.name: Towering Dark Young
cards.text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you: Test [willpower] (0).  For each point you succeed by, reduce the horror dealt by this attack by 1.

cards.flavor:
This creature is highly skittish,
and will latch onto the first thing it sees.
cards.name: Towering Dark Young
cards.text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you, choose and discard a non-weakness asset from your hand or your play area: Cancel this attack.

cards.flavor:
This abomination is highly aggressive,
but can still be beaten back.
cards.name: Towering Dark Young
cards.text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you: Make an attack against Towering Dark Young as if it were at your location.  If you succeed, instead of resolving the effects of the successful attack, cancel Towering Dark Young's attack.

cards.flavor:
This abomination has razor-honed sense,
but can still be fooled.
cards.name: Towering Dark Young
cards.text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you: Make an investigation attempt.  If you succeed, instead of resolving the effects of the successful investigation, cancel Towering Dark Young's attack.

cards.name: Close Watch
cards.text: Revelation - Put Close Watch into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When you would take an action to move from a location, you must (choose one): - Spend 1 additional action. - After completing this action, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Spawn that enemy at your location. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Close Watch.

cards.name: Keep Quiet
cards.text: Revelation - Put Keep Quiet into play in your threat area. Forced - After you deal 1 or more damage to an enemy or discover 1 or more clues: Place 1 doom on the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy. [reaction] After an enemy at your location is evaded: Discard Keep Quiet.

cards.name: Sacrificial Shepherd
cards.text: Spawn - Any location (with a [[Bystander]] asset or story card, if possible). While Sacrificial Shepherd is ready, investigators cannot activate abilities on [[Bystander]] assets or story cards at Sacrificial Shepherd's location. If there are no [[Bystander]] assets or story cards at Sacrificial Shepherd's location, it gains hunter and gets +1 evade and +1 damage.

cards.flavor:
The massive dark young lash out violently
as they await feeding by their circus handlers.
cards.name: Violent Thrashing
cards.text: Revelation - Reveal a fury token.

cards.name: All Points West
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X.  X is equal to half the doom in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1.  If you fail, place 1 doom on Locomotive Engine.
[tablet]: -1.  If you fail, draw the topmost [[Hazard]] treachery in the encounter discard pile.
[elder_thing]: -2.  If you fail, ready a [[Dark Young]] enemy in play.

cards.name: All Points West
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X.  X is equal to 1 + half the doom in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2.  Place 1 doom on Locomotive Engine.
[tablet]: -2.  Draw the topmost [[Hazard]] treachery in the encounter discard pile.
[elder_thing]: -2.  Ready a [[Dark Young]] enemy in play.

cards.flavor: It'll be a marathon journey to reach California in a reasonable time frame.  You'll get brief windows to recover each time you reach one of the major cities along the route, but don't spread yourself too thin.
cards.name: Schedule to Keep
cards.text: This agenda cannot advance by reaching a doom threshold. Forced - When an investigator would be defeated, if there are 1 or more undefeated investigators: Advance this agenda. (The scenario will not end.)

cards.name: Blood on the Line
cards.text:
If this agenda advanced due to an investigator defeat:
Overwhelmed, you fall to the floor of the train, unconscious.
Do not remove doom from this agenda. The defeated investigator moves their investigator mini-card beneath the agenda. Do not remove cards controlled by that investigator from play. The next time the act advances, each defeated investigator heals damage and horror until they have at least 3 remaining health and sanity. Those investigators are no longer defeated, but still suffer the trauma from their defeat (and are killed or driven insane if their trauma is high enough). Move their investigator minicards to Caboose. Flip this agenda back to its 'a' side. Otherwise:
Carrie shouts for you to brace for a crash as the attackers force the train to jump the tracks, sending it grinding off beside the rails.
Each investigator is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

cards.flavor: Your body is filled with tension as the train lurches forward, departing from Northside station with a hiss of steam.  You keep a wary eye on the trees bordering the rail line, knowing that any of Blake's agents left behind to monitor you will soon be on alert.  Anything you can do to speed the trip will be welcome.
cards.name: Through the Forests (v.I)
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if investigators as a group possess the requisite number of clues, they may advance. (Enemies still in play will delay you!)

cards.name: Arriving at Chicago
cards.text:
The train eases to a halt in the yards outside Central Station, marking the end of this leg of the journey. Ralph and Carrie deliver and take on new cargo to keep their cover, leaving you free for the moment.
For each enemy in play, place 1 doom on the agenda. Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, read Not in This Town under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. - ...7 or more doom in play, read Wrong Territory under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. Remove all doom from play. Discard each enemy. Replace each [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location with another random set-aside [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location. Move each replaced location with Victory X and no clues to the victory display. Fully replenish the clues on Locomotive Engine and Caboose. Put a random set-aside [[Dark Young]] enemy into play at Caboose.

cards.flavor: You breathe a long sigh -- both in resignation and preparation -- as the train departs through the swampy forests of Louisiana.  You'll miss the circus appearance in Chicago, but perhaps there's something useful you can uncover in Memphis, where the circus used to tour.  Thea settles into the caboose, poring over Blake's tome as the journey begins anew.
cards.name: Through the Forests (v.II)
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if investigators as a group possess the requisite number of clues, they may advance. (Enemies still in play will delay you!)

cards.name: Arriving at Memphis
cards.text:
The train eases to a halt in the yards outside Central Station, marking the end of this leg of the journey. Ralph and Carrie deliver and take on new cargo to keep their cover, leaving you free for the moment.
For each enemy in play, place 1 doom on the agenda. Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, read Stomping Ground under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. - ...7 or more doom in play, read Fool's Errand under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. Remove all doom from play. Discard each enemy. Replace each [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location with another random set-aside [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location. Move each replaced location with Victory X and no clues to the victory display. Fully replenish the clues on Locomotive Engine and Caboose. Put a random set-aside [[Dark Young]] enemy into play at Caboose.

cards.flavor: You've barely begun the trek to St. Louis when a monstrous thing hurls itself out of the nearby woodland, clinging on to the back of the caboose.  Carrie nearly screams at the sight of the horrible creature, but instead manages to call the danger to your attention.  You've got to get this unwanted passenger off the train!
cards.name: No Free Rides
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if there are no [[Dark Young]] enemies in play, you may advance.

cards.name: Arriving at St. Louis
cards.text:
With the horrible creature left screaming on the tracks behind you, you complete the short journey to Union Station.
For each enemy in play, place 1 doom on the agenda. Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, read Nature of the Beast under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. - ...7 or more doom in play, read Skeletons in the Closet under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. Remove all doom from play. Discard each enemy. Replace each [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location with another random set-aside [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location. Move each replaced location with Victory X and no clues to the victory display. Fully replenish the clues on Locomotive Engine and Caboose. Put a random set-aside [[Dark Young]] enemy into play at Locomotive Engine.

cards.flavor: As the wide open plains give way to rocky hills, Ralph suddenly shouts to brace for impact, and the train shakes violently.  Another monster, waiting on the tracks before you, has leapt up onto the engine.  You must drive the fiend away before it damages the engine!
cards.name: Engine Trouble
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if there are no [[Dark Young]] enemies in play, you may advance.

cards.name: Arriving at Denver
cards.text:
Another close call, but the monster was successfully repelled, and the welcome arch of Union Station looms ahead.
For each enemy in play, place 1 doom on the agenda. Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, read Behind the Curtain under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. - ...7 or more doom in play, read Humane Treatment under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. Remove all doom from play. Discard each enemy. Replace each [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location with another random set-aside [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location. Move each replaced location with Victory X and no clues to the victory display. Fully replenish the clues on Locomotive Engine and Caboose. Put each set-aside [[Circus Train]] location into play. Put a random set-aside [[Dark Young]] enemy into play at Exotic Animal Car.

cards.flavor: The long and surprisingly peaceful journey through the western badlands makes you hope to arrive without incident.  However, as you near civilization once more, multiple rail lines run parallel to each other, another train suddenly appears beside yours.  One of the circus trains was waiting in ambush!
cards.name: The Great Train Horror
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if there is 9 or more doom in play: Immediately advance to agenda 1b. Objective - If there is 4[per_investigator] or more damage on Circus Engine, you may advance.

cards.name: Arriving at Los Angeles
cards.text:
With the brakes of the circus train locked and its controls damaged, you leap back onto your own train. Ralph and Carrie give full steam ahead, speeding you onward to the coast.
Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, (→R3). - ...7 or more doom in play, (→R4).

cards.flavor:
The comforts of the caboose are the closest thing you have
to a home away from home.
cards.name: Caboose
cards.text:
[action] If there are no enemies at Caboose:
Heal 1 damage. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The front of the train is the best position
to see what's coming down the line.
cards.name: Locomotive Engine
cards.text: [action]: Look at the top 4 cards of the encounter deck.  Put them back on top of the deck in the same order.  (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: The calm and enclosed car makes respite a little easier.
cards.name: Boxcar
cards.text: [reaction] After you play an event that targets an investigator: Draw a card. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
Being completely exposed on the moving train
does little to calm your nerves.
cards.name: Flatcar
cards.text: Forced - After you end your turn at Flatcar, if there are 1 or more clues on it: Choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.flavor:
You may be able to exploit the sloped cars
against anything attacking you.
cards.name: Gondola Car
cards.text: [reaction] After you play an event that targets an enemy: Draw a card. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The cattle being transported are understandably skittish.
You both might benefit from calming them down a little.
cards.name: Stock Car
cards.text: [action]: You pet the cows.  Heal 1 horror.  (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The cylindrical car makes it difficult
to find footing while the train is moving.
cards.name: Tank Car
cards.text: Forced - After you end your turn at Tank Car, if there are 1 or more clues on it: Lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor:
Some of the coal here is of noticeably higher quality.
Think they'll miss a couple chunks?
cards.name: Coal Hopper Car
cards.text: While there are no clues on Coal Hopper Car, treat the agenda as if there were 1 fewer total doom on it.

cards.flavor:
If you can learn the controls,
this mechanical crane might prove a useful tool.
cards.name: Crane Car
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Crane Car: Disengage and move an investigator or non-[[Elite]] enemy from any location directly to Crane Car.  (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
Something about a mail room lends itself
toward organizing the mind.
cards.name: Mail Car
cards.text: [reaction] After you draw a card during the upkeep phase, if there are no clues on Mail Car: Draw an additional card. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Perfectly preserved for when you want it fresh.
cards.name: Refrigerator Car
cards.text: While there are no clues on Refrigerator Car, the first asset played at Refrigerator Car by each investigator each round gets -1 cost.

cards.flavor:
While meant to protect the car's contents,
the extra protection could be of use to you as well.
cards.name: Reinforced Car
cards.text: [reaction] When an enemy attacks you, if there are no clues on Reinforced Car: Reduce the damage or horror dealt by that attack by 1 (choose one).

cards.flavor: You've got to put this engine out of commission.
cards.name: Circus Engine
cards.text:
[action] Spend 1-3 clues: Place an equal amount of damage on Circus Engine.
[action]: Take a fight action against Circus Engine's shroud value.  If you succeed, instead of dealing damage, place 1 damage on Circus Engine (2 damage instead if this attack would deal 3 or more damage).

cards.flavor:
The brightly-painted engine disguises
the horrors in tow.
cards.name: Circus Engine

cards.flavor: Nothing like a caged beast to increase the danger.
cards.name: Exotic Animal Car
cards.text: While fighting or evading [[Monster]] enemies at Exotic Animal Car, treat each [skull] token revealed as if it were a [auto_fail] token instead.

cards.flavor:
A grotesque abomination rises through
the broken roof of this car, roaring savagely.
cards.name: Exotic Animal Car

cards.flavor: Invasion of privacy is the least of your worries right now.
cards.name: Performers' Car
cards.text: Performers' Car gets +1 shroud value for each enemy at this location.

cards.flavor: The performer trailers have been strapped down to flatbeds, converting them into coaches of a sort.
cards.name: Performers' Car
Carrie Dykstra
cards.text:
[free] Exhaust Carrie Dykstra: Move her to a connecting [[Train]] location.  Investigators at any location may trigger this ability.
Carrie Dykstra's location gains "[reaction] After you enter this location: Test [combat] or [agility] (2).  If you succeed, move to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)"

cards.name: Ralph Dykstra
cards.text: [free] If Ralph Dykstra is ready, investigators at Locomotive Engine place 1[per_investigator] clues on Locomotive Engine as a group: Remove 1 doom from any card in play.  Any investigator at Locomotive Engine may trigger this ability. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.name: Looming Goatspawn
cards.text: Massive. Alert. Forced - If Looming Goatspawn would be defeated by damage from an investigator with 1 or more tokens sealed on their investigator card: Cancel that damage. [reaction] After 1 or more damage is dealt to Looming Goatspawn, spend 1-3 clues as a group: Deal 1 additional damage to Looming Goatspawn for each clue spent.

cards.name: Rampaging Goatspawn
cards.text: Massive. Forced - After you attack Rampaging Goatspawn: For each token sealed on your investigator card, discard a card from your hand at random. [reaction] After 1 or more damage is dealt to Rampaging Goatspawn, spend 1-3 clues as a group: Deal 1 additional damage to Rampaging Goatspawn for each clue spent.

cards.name: Ravenous Goatspawn
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Alert. Forced - After Ravenous Goatspawn attacks you, if there are 1 or more tokens sealed on your investigator card: Lose 2 resources. [reaction] After 1 or more damage is dealt to Ravenous Goatspawn, spend 1-3 clues as a group: Deal 1 additional damage to Ravenous Goatspawn for each clue spent.

cards.name: Writhing Goatspawn
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Forced - After you enter Writhing Goatspawn's location, if Writhing Goatspawn is ready and there are 1 or more tokens sealed on your investigator card: Writhing Goatspawn attacks you. [reaction] After 1 or more damage is dealt to Writhing Goatspawn, spend 1-3 clues as a group: Deal 1 additional damage to Writhing Goatspawn for each clue spent.

cards.flavor:
Connected now only by emergency cables,
the two cars now ride a dangerous distance apart.
cards.name: Broken Couplings
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Place Broken Couplings between two [[Train]] locations without a copy between them. Investigators cannot move between these two locations. [action] Spend 2 resources: Discard Broken Couplings. Investigators at either location may activate this ability.

cards.name: Focused Sabotage
cards.text: Revelation - Put Focused Sabotage into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After doom is placed on an enemy: It makes an immediate attack against the nearest investigator. (Max once per enemy per phase.) Forced - After an enemy with 1 or more doom on it is evaded: Discard a copy of Focused Sabotage. (Max once per enemy).

cards.name: New Moon Stiltwalker
cards.text: Spawn - Any location (without investigators, if possible). Hunter. Alert. While resolving the hunter keyword, New Moon Stiltwalker's location is considered to be connected to each other location.

cards.name: New Moon Tumbler
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. While there is 1 or more doom on New Moon Tumbler, it gets +1 horror. While there is 2 or more doom on New Moon Tumbler, it gets +1 damage. Forced - After New Moon Tumbler attacks: Place 1 doom on New Moon Tumbler.

cards.flavor: Ralph grimaces as he grapples with the valves.
cards.name: Overloaded Engine
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Overloaded Engine to Locomotive Engine and exhaust Ralph Dykstra. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 doom on Locomotive Engine. [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Overloaded Engine.

cards.flavor: Carrie hollers to hold on tight for rough tracks.
cards.name: Rickety Ride
cards.text: Revelation - Exhaust Carrie Dykstra. Test [willpower] or [agility] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each connection you are from Locomotive Engine. If you fail, take 1 horror and lose 2 resources.

cards.name: Piper at the Gates of Dawn
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2.  -4 instead if there are 5 or more resources on this card.
[cultist]: -3.  If there is a [[Hex]] treachery at your location, discard a card from your hand at random.
[tablet]: -3.  If there is a [[Performer]] enemy at your location, lose 1 resource.
[elder_thing]: -3.  -5 instead if this is a test against an [[Elite]] enemy.

cards.name: Piper at the Gates of Dawn
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3.  -5 instead if there are 5 or more resources on this card.
[cultist]: -4.  If there is a [[Hex]] treachery at your location, discard 2 cards from your hand at random.
[tablet]: -4.  If there is a [[Performer]] enemy at your location, lose 2 resources.
[elder_thing]: -4.  -6 instead if this is a test against an [[Elite]] enemy.

cards.flavor: You find yourself trapped once again in the New Moon Circus, though this time for an exclusive performance.  It would be an honor if every other thing on the circus grounds wasn't out to kill you.
cards.name: Repeat Showing
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, replenish all clues on each revealed The Big Top location.

cards.name: Light of the False Moon
cards.text:
You've been so used to facing the circus in dark and moonlit places that you almost didn't realize that there is a full moon shining down on the circus grounds. The moon is almost empty, but its light seems very real -- just like the other illusions.
In player order, each investigator without a token sealed on their investigator card searches the chaos bag for one and seals it on their investigator card. Each investigator who cannot seal a token loses an action.

cards.flavor: Real or not, the moon above the veiled circus glows with a very real power.  Its light lends an eerie strength to the circus performers and monsters roaming the grounds.  It's difficult to dismiss illusions that can kill you.
cards.name: Doom and Gloom
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, replenish all clues on each revealed The Big Top location.

cards.name: Blue Moon
cards.text:
With each passing moment, the moon looms ever closer, as if descending onto the circus grounds. Surely a catastrophic illusion like that is beyond Blake's capacity, or he would have done it from the start... right?
In player order, each investigator without a token sealed on their investigator card searches the chaos bag for one and seals it on their investigator card. Each investigator who cannot seal a token loses 1 action.

cards.flavor: The illusions begin to blend and brighten in a frightening and ever-increasing display.  You'll be completely overwhelmed by the lights and sounds alone if you don't break the spell and escape!
cards.name: Whirling Spectacle
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, replenish all clues on each revealed The Big Top location.

cards.name: Life is an Illusion
cards.text:
The illusions strobe and blare, overwhelming your senses from every angle and forcing you to your knees in physical pain at the assault.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

cards.flavor: Illusions circle around you once more, this time much more complex and dazzling than the ones back in Arkham.  Even the central tent for all its size and grandeur blurs and twists when you approach.  You'll have to leverage your wits once more to undo the illusions trapping you here on the grounds.
cards.name: All's Fair
cards.text:
Treat Circus Gates' printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]])
Investigators cannot enter The Big Top.

cards.name: The Show Must Go On
cards.text:
Once more, you slowly but deliberately unravel the illusions permeating the grounds and unmask the hidden entrance. You are now free to escape... but for the first time now, Sylvester Blake is in sight without crowds of innocents in need of protection. In spite of the other illusions, this may be your only chance to fight Blake without any handicaps.
Reveal each The Big Top location and place an additional 1[per_investigator] clues on each. Put the set-aside Sylvester Blake into play between the three The Big Top locations.

cards.flavor: The big top looms before you, and Blake's voice booms out from it, dripping with dark intention and echoing around the circus.  "Ladies and gentlemen, applause for our noble friends as they step into the jaws of death!"
cards.name: Audience Participation (v.I)
cards.text: [reaction] After a token is released at The Big Top, spend 1 clue: Seal that token on Sylvester Blake. [free] If you are at The Big Top, spend 2 clues: Search the token bag for a token and seal it on Sylvester Blake. Objective - If Sylvester Blake would be defeated, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Release the Beast
cards.text:
The ringmaster's tricks and tactics fail to fool you, and he collapses down, coughing black ichor. Blake's ever-present grin is clenched in hate, but still smiling as he rises up. His skin seems to fade into the shadow, and his form mutates. Rapidly Blake evolves into one of the horrid caprine creatures, only much larger, and with that same glint of intelligent malice still in its eyes. A primal scream from its many mouths rips through the air.
Remove all damage from Sylvester Blake and flip him. If an investigator has Monstrous Transformation in their deck:
The bestial roar from the abomination triggers a primal urge deep within you, one you've only felt since your assumption of the curse in New Orleans. A need to fight savagery with savagery.
If Monstrous Transformation is in play, you may search the chaos bag for a token and seal it on The Black Goat. Otherwise, you may search your deck, discard pile, and hand for Monstrous Transformation and put it into play.

cards.flavor: The big top looms before you, and Blake's voice booms out from it, dripping with dark intention and echoing around the circus.  "Step right up to the final performance of your life!  Man against nature, but which is man and which nature?"
cards.name: Audience Participation (v.II)
cards.text: [reaction] After a token is released at The Big Top, spend 2 clues: Seal that token on Sylvester Blake. [free] If you are at The Big Top, spend 2 clues: Search the token bag for a token and seal it on Sylvester Blake. Objective - If Sylvester Blake would be defeated, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Release the Beast
cards.text:
The ringmaster's tricks and tactics fail to fool you, and he collapses down, coughing black ichor. Blake's ever-present grin is clenched in hate, but still smiling as he rises up. His skin seems to fade into the shadow, and his form mutates. Rapidly Blake evolves into one of the horrid caprine creatures, only much larger, and with that same glint of intelligent malice still in its eyes. A primal scream from its many mouths rips through the air.
Remove all damage from Sylvester Blake and flip him. If an investigator has Monstrous Transformation in their deck:
The bestial roar from the abomination triggers a primal urge deep within you, one you've only felt since your assumption of the curse in New Orleans. A need to fight savagery with savagery.
If Monstrous Transformation is in play, you may search the chaos bag for a token and seal it on The Black Goat. Otherwise, you may search your deck, discard pile, and hand for Monstrous Transformation and put it into play.

cards.flavor: The big top looms before you, and Blake's voice booms out from it, dripping with dark intention and echoing around the circus.  "Come now, don't be shy!  You've kept the crowd waiting, and they must be satisfied with a real show!"
cards.name: Audience Participation (v.III)
cards.text: [reaction] After a token is released at The Big Top, spend 2 clues and discard a card from your hand: Seal that token on Sylvester Blake. [free] If you are at The Big Top, spend 2 clues: Search the token bag for a token and seal it on Sylvester Blake. Objective - If Sylvester Blake would be defeated, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Release the Beast
cards.text:
The ringmaster's tricks and tactics fail to fool you, and he collapses down, coughing black ichor. Blake's ever-present grin is clenched in hate, but still smiling as he rises up. His skin seems to fade into the shadow, and his form mutates. Rapidly Blake evolves into one of the horrid caprine creatures, only much larger, and with that same glint of intelligent malice still in its eyes. A primal scream from its many mouths rips through the air.
Remove all damage from Sylvester Blake and flip him. If an investigator has Monstrous Transformation in their deck:
The bestial roar from the abomination triggers a primal urge deep within you, one you've only felt since your assumption of the curse in New Orleans. A need to fight savagery with savagery.
If Monstrous Transformation is in play, you may search the chaos bag for a token and seal it on The Black Goat. Otherwise, you may search your deck, discard pile, and hand for Monstrous Transformation and put it into play.

cards.flavor: This is no illusion.  Whether Blake has become the monster or always was one in disguise, it doesn't change the fact that you must strike the fiend down and end this bestial spectacle.
cards.name: The True Monster
cards.text: [free] Spend 1 clue: Search the chaos bag for a token and seal it on The Black Goat. Objective - If The Black Goat is defeated, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Got His Goat
cards.text:
You have stepped into the role of the beast tamer in this mad circus. The monster lashes and bays with frightening power, but you beat it back with equal courage. With all of Blake's subtlety beaten, there is little left but monstrous strength, and as you prove with one final blow, it is not enough to stop you.
(→R4)

cards.flavor:
Can you possibly escape?
Do you even want to at such a critical reckoning?
cards.name: Circus Gates
cards.text: [action]: Resign. You escape before this trap spells your end.

cards.flavor:
The circus sign looms above the iron bars,
glowing with the light of a moon
that shouldn't be shining down.
cards.name: Circus Gates
Sylvester Blake
cards.subname: Ringmaster of the New Moon Circus
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Alert. Sylvester Blake is considered to be at each The Big Top location. Forced - When Sylvester Blake would take any amount of damage: Release a token sealed on him. If you cannot, cancel that damage.

cards.name: The Black Goat
cards.text: Massive. The Black Goat is considered to be at each The Big Top location. Forced - When you initiate an attack against The Black Goat: You must either release a token from The Black Goat or it readies and makes an immediate attack against you.

cards.name: Duplicitous Illusion
cards.text: Revelation - Put Duplicitous Illusion into play in your threat area. Forced - When you activate an [action] ability on an asset you control: Reveal a random chaos token. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], [auto_fail], or token, place 1 doom on that asset. [action]: Search the bag for a token and seal it on your investigator card. Then, discard Duplicitous Illusion.

cards.name: Phantom Beasts
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Phantom Beasts to your location. Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at the attached location tests [willpower] or [agility] (4). Each investigator that fails discards an asset they control. [reaction] After you successfully investigate the attached location: Instead of discovering clues, discard Phantom Beasts.

cards.name: Shadowy Performance
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Shadowy Performance to your location. Investigators at the attached location get -1 to each of their skills for each token sealed on their investigator card. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Shadowy Performance.

cards.name: Bacchanalia
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X.  X is equal to half the number of vices you have (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2.  -4 instead if this test is an investigation attempt.
[tablet]: -2.  -4 instead if there is a [[Cultist]] enemy at your location.
[elder_thing]: -2.  -4 instead if this test is part of a parley action.

cards.name: Bacchanalia
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X.  X is equal to 1 + half the number of vices you have (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3.  -5 instead if this test is an investigation attempt.
[tablet]: -3.  -5 instead if there is a [[Cultist]] enemy at your location.
[elder_thing]: -3.  -5 instead if this test is part of a parley action.

cards.flavor:
The society manor sits on a hill in a wealthier neighborhood, deliberately isolated for reasons you know all too well.  You stride up to the doors and ring the bell, and almost at once, a grim-faced valet answers the door.  You say that you've been invited by Sylvester Blake, and the man sweeps his arm to welcome you in, his expression shifting to a sly smile.
"Do enjoy yourself tonight."
cards.name: Into the Lion's Den
Heat of the Moment
cards.text:
The longer you spend in the manor, the more that their overindulgence affects you. You wonder if something supernatural is at work, or simply human nature at its worst, but you have to resist or escape the influence in either case.
In player order, each investigator tests [willpower] or [agility] (X), where X is the total number of tokens sealed on investigator cards. Each investigator who fails must choose and discard half the cards in their hand and lose half the resources in their resource pool (rounded up).

cards.flavor: Be it magic or malicious nature, the society is growing unhinged at a rapid pace.  You'd best make your investigation a swift one if you don't want to get swallowed up in the tide of immorality.
cards.name: Lack of Restraint
Popular Demand
cards.text:
The society aren't content to debauch themselves, and continually offer to you to join in their wild activities. Can you resist their advances?
In player order, each investigator tests [willpower] or [agility] (X), where X is the total number of tokens sealed on investigator cards. Each investigator who fails must choose and discard half the cards in their hand and lose half the resources in their resource pool (rounded up).

cards.flavor: The society members continue their revelry without morality, acting more and more like wild animals the further they plunge.  The parallels to the savagery of Shub-Niggurath become more and more apparent.
cards.name: Fever Pitch
Utter Pandemonium
cards.text:
There's no real trigger for it, but the crowd inside the mansion has reached its break point, and is nothing more than a maddened mob in fancy clothing. You escape wild blows amid a din of animalistic fury, fleeing out the front door of the manor for your life.
Each investigator is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

cards.flavor: You step forward warily into the den of excess.  Wine flows freely -- the rich never affected by prohibition, of course -- while guests in lavish outfits converse and carouse.  You can only guess if this is standard for the society, or if they conduct their cult affairs once their invited guests have gone.  You must learn what you can amid this unrestrained party, especially before someone discovers your true purpose here -- particularly the circus members who may recognize you.
cards.name: Behind Closed Doors
Dirty Laundry
cards.text:
Having toured the manor extensively, you're already certain that anything hidden would be beneath the mansion, but it isn't until you schmooze with the society members for some time that someone lets secrets slip. The catacombs have a hidden entrance through the wine cellars connected to the kitchens, as well as one through a trap door hidden in the garden. You discover as well that the society has been holding sacrifices for the coming ritual, imprisoned in cells connected to their altar chamber. Given the chamber has no view of the moon, you doubt that the mansion is the site of tomorrow's ritual, but it's a start.
Put each of the set-aside [[Restricted]] locations into play.

cards.flavor: If the ritual details are anywhere in the manor, the catacombs are the place.  You must get down there without delay!
cards.name: Deeper Profanities
cards.text: Objective - After an investigator enters Savage Altar, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Years in the Making
cards.text:
You cautiously enter the deepest chamber, taking care not to disturb the horrid structures. If there was any doubt at all before now, the altar to Shub-Niggurath lies at the very back, though not barren. Unlike the occult trappings, papers lie on the stone altar, each marked with scientific precision. The cult was tracking the exact path of the eclipse and determined the ideal place to conduct the ritual in its path. You have barely finished noting the ritual coordinates when the clack of cloven hooves on the stone floor sounds behind you.
Spawn the set-aside Goatspawn Corruptor at Savage Altar. If both Manor Cellars and Hidden Dungeon are revealed, Goatspawn Corruptor enters play exhausted.

cards.flavor: With the ritual site known, you must get safely away from the manor and the cult's clutches!
cards.name: Fashionably Early
cards.text: Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Party's Over
cards.text:
With the other wild partying still ongoing, you find it surprisingly easy to slip out the front door and retreat down the path back to the city. With any luck, nobody will notice your escape until you're back at the hotel.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: You don't want to stay long in a place this corrupt.
cards.name: Vestibule
cards.text: [action]: Resign. "It's been a wonderful evening, but I really must be going."

cards.flavor: The entryway is merely the point of decision for the society.  Which debauchery will they indulge in this time?
cards.name: Vestibule

cards.flavor:
Though fitting for all of the debauchery in the manor,
excess is the only way to describe the refreshments here.
cards.name: Banquet Hall
cards.text:
While you are investigating Banquet Hall, if you have "a vice for revelry," it gets -2 shroud value.
[free] Spend 1 supply, ammo, charge, or secret from an asset you control: You get +1 skill value while parleying at Banquet Hall until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: Judging by the strong smells of alcohol and expensive seasonings, you don't have to guess what you'll find here.
cards.name: Banquet Hall

cards.flavor:
The gardens are a quarantine for members to release their anger.
Broken statues and other damaged objects litter the grounds.
cards.name: Statuary Gardens
cards.text:
While you are investigating Statuary Gardens, if you have "a vice for violence," it gets -2 shroud value.
[reaction] After you deal 1 or more damage to an enemy at Statuary Gardens: You get +1 skill value while parleying at Statuary Gardens until the end of the round.

cards.flavor:
The open air gardens are a breath of fresh air,
but the sounds of destruction echo up into the night.
cards.name: Statuary Gardens

cards.flavor:
Society members mingle and tangle as they will,
and you're lucky if any of them can spare you a word in between.
cards.name: Private Parlor
cards.text:
While you are investigating Private Parlor, if you have "a vice for intimacy," it gets -2 shroud value.
[free] Exhaust a non-[[Creature Ally]] asset you control: You get +1 skill value while parleying at Private Parlor until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: The fragrance of perfume and varying degrees of laughter make it clear that it's adults only through this door.
cards.name: Private Parlor

cards.flavor:
The way that the society members talk, you'd think that
each of them personally owned the whole gallery.
cards.name: Collection Hall
cards.text:
While you are investigating Collection Hall, if you have "a vice for opulence," it gets -2 shroud value.
You get +1 skill value while parleying at Collection Hall for every 5 resources in your resource pool.

cards.flavor:
One look through the open door makes you wonder
if they'll charge admission.
cards.name: Collection Hall

cards.flavor:
The balcony overlooks a sheer drop of three stories.
It would be a shame if anyone got careless in their partying.
cards.name: Upper Balcony
cards.text:
[reaction] After you evade an enemy at Upper Balcony by 2 or more: Defeat that enemy.
You get +1 skill value while parleying at Upper Balcony for every 4 cards in your hand.

cards.flavor:
The roof of the society manor house seems to be
the only escape from the wild activities beneath it.
cards.name: Upper Balcony

cards.flavor: You must free these unfortunate victims!
cards.name: Hidden Dungeon
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Hidden Dungeon, attach both set-aside copies of Terrified Captives to Hidden Dungeon. Shuffle each set-aside copy of Wild Hysteria into the encounter deck. While there are no clues on Hidden Dungeon, each test on a card attached to Hidden Dungeon gets -2 difficulty.

cards.flavor:
The moment you pry open the hidden door in the garden,
the soft and muted sounds of distress come wafting up.
cards.name: Hidden Dungeon

cards.flavor:
It's more time consuming than tricky to find
the right barrel of wine with a false facade.
cards.name: Manor Cellars
cards.text: Investigators cannot move to Savage Altar from Manor Cellars while there are 1 or more clues on it. Forced - After an investigator moves to Manor Cellars from Savage Altar: Remove each clue from Manor Cellars.

cards.flavor: The kitchen staff are likely too busy with their constant flow of food and drink to notice you slip down the cellar stairs.
cards.name: Manor Cellars

cards.flavor: What other secrets of the cult may be hidden here?
cards.name: Savage Altar
cards.text: Forced - When your turn begins at Savage Altar: You must either search the chaos bag for a token and seal it on your investigator card or lose 1 action (choose one).

cards.flavor:
The musty smell of antiquity permeates the halls.
You wonder if this profane site even predates the manor.
cards.name: Savage Altar

cards.flavor:
Mr. Sharpe makes it clear that he detests violence,
but is still very eager to talk about gruesome topics.
cards.name: Cecil Sharpe
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (5). If you have "a vice for violence," this test gets -2 difficulty. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Cecil Sharpe. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Cecil Sharpe's location. If you fail, take 1 damage.

cards.flavor:
Ms. Meredith has a keen eye for very valuable things,
and getting her talking is a simple matter of quality.
cards.name: Esther Meredith
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (5). If you have "a vice for opulence," this test gets -2 difficulty. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Esther Meredith. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Esther Meredith's location. If you fail, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
While not a member, Mr. Hutchins is highly observant.
You might gain his trust by sharing your own misgivings.
cards.name: Phillip Hutchins
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test any skill (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each vice you have. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Phillip Hutchins. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Phillip Hutchins's location. If you fail, lose 1 action.

cards.flavor:
Mr. Stratton is loose-lipped when he gets liquored up,
but is also known for his terrible temper.
cards.name: Richard Stratton
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (5). If you have "a vice for revelry," this test gets -2 difficulty. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Richard Stratton. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Richard Stratton's location. If you fail, take 1 damage.

cards.flavor:
Ms. Ashcroft knows what she wants, but if you play along,
you might get some information in the process.
cards.name: Vera Ashcroft
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (5). If you have "a vice for intimacy," this test gets -2 difficulty. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Vera Ashcroft. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Vera Ashcroft's location. If you fail, take 1 horror.

cards.name: Goatspawn Corruptor
cards.text: While Goatspawn Corruptor is ready, Savage Altar gets +3 shroud value. Goatspawn Corruptor gains retaliate and alert while engaged with an investigator with 1 or more tokens sealed on their investigator card. [reaction] After you defeat Goatspawn Corruptor: Discover 1[per_investigator] clues from Savage Altar.

cards.name: All That Glitters
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one, two instead if you have "a vice for opulence"): - Lose 1 action. - Lose 3 resources. - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, lose 3 resources.

cards.name: Best Left Unsaid
cards.text: Revelation - Put Best Left Unsaid into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After you take a parley action or end your turn at a [[Restricted]] location: You must place 1 of your clues on your location. If you cannot, take 1 damage and 1 horror. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Best Left Unsaid.

cards.name: Brash Lothario
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with "a vice for intimacy." Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Brash Lothario's location chooses and discards a card from their hand. Each investigator with "a vice for intimacy" chooses and discards an additional card. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you have "a vice for intimacy," this test gets +2 difficulty and other investigators cannot commit cards to it. If you succeed, discard Brash Lothario.

cards.name: Destructive Impulses
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one, two instead if you have "a vice for violence"): - Lose 1 action. - Take 2 damage. - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 2 damage.

cards.name: Drink and Be Merry
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one, two instead if you have "a vice for revelry"): - Lose 1 action. - Take 2 horror. - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 2 horror.

cards.name: Party Animal
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with "a vice for revelry." Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Party Animal's location takes 1 horror. Each investigator with "a vice for revelry" takes 1 additional horror. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you have "a vice for revelry," this test gets +2 difficulty and other investigators cannot commit cards to it. If you succeed, discard Party Animal.

cards.name: Perfume and Passion
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one, two instead if you have "a vice for intimacy"): - Lose 1 action. - Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand. - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, choose and discard 2 cards from your hand.

cards.name: Sadistic Socialite
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with "a vice for violence." Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Sadistic Socialite's location takes 1 damage. Each investigator with "a vice for violence" takes 1 additional damage. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you have "a vice for violence," this test gets +2 difficulty and other investigators cannot commit cards to it. If you succeed, discard Sadistic Socialite.

cards.name: Strutting Peacock
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with "a vice for opulence." Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Strutting Peacock's location loses a resource. Each investigator with "a vice for opulence" loses an additional resource. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you have "a vice for opulence," this test gets +2 difficulty and other investigators cannot commit cards to it. If you succeed, discard Strutting Peacock.

cards.name: Red Sunrise
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1.  -3 instead if there is a [[Monster]] or [[Cultist]] enemy in your row.
[cultist]: 0.  If you do not succeed by X (where X is the number of locations in your row), draw the top card of the encounter deck.
[tablet]: 0.  If you do not succeed by X (where X is the number of locations in your row), lose an action.
[elder_thing]: -2.  If you fail, move the nearest enemy once toward your location.

cards.name: Red Sunrise
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2.  -4 instead if there is a [[Monster]] or [[Cultist]] enemy in your row.
[cultist]: -1.  If you do not succeed by X (where X is the number of locations in your row), draw the top card of the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -1.  If you do not succeed by X (where X is the number of locations in your row), lose an action.
[elder_thing]: -3.  Move the nearest enemy once toward your location.

cards.flavor: Though bright as ever, the sunlight seems a shade redder to you in the sequoia forest.  The ritual will be conducted deeper into the woods, but you can be sure that agents of Shub-Niggurath will be lurking throughout.  Proceed carefully to the site, following your discovery.
cards.name: Fading Sunlight (v.I)
Darkness Falls
cards.text:
A chill runs through your spine as the woods darken around you. The eclipse has begun, and with the ritual still active, it will never end. A horrid cacophony of growling, baying, and shrieking resounds through the woods in the permanent twilight. Under the new moon, Shub-Niggurath has come.
(→R1)

cards.flavor: Though bright as ever, the sunlight seems a shade redder to you in the sequoia forest.  The ritual will be conducted deeper into the woods, but you can be sure that agents of Shub-Niggurath will be lurking throughout.  Proceed carefully to the site, following your foes.
cards.name: Fading Sunlight (v.II)
cards.text:
Investigators cannot spend clues unless there is an enemy at their location.
[free] If Devotee of the Thousand is set aside: Spawn it at your location.

cards.name: Darkness Falls
cards.text:
A chill runs through your spine as the woods darken around you. The eclipse has begun, and with the ritual still active, it will never end. A horrid cacophony of growling, baying, and shrieking resounds through the woods in the permanent twilight. Under the new moon, Shub-Niggurath has come.
(→R1)

cards.flavor: Despite the enormity of the woods and the spaces between the trees, navigating the forest is no simple task.  You must trace a path to the ritual site before it's too late.
cards.name: Forest of Giants (v.I)
cards.text: [free] Investigators spend X[per_investigator] clues as a group, where X is 1 less than the number of locations in your row: Flip the facedown Path Forward card beside your row faceup. Objective - After an investigator enters Ritual Clearing, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Driven by Desperation
cards.text:
Your entrance to the ritual site is met with a scene of near chaos. Deprived of their leader due to your slaying of Sylvester Blake, the remaining cultists are in a state of mindless zealotry, and advance on you like demons possessed to salvage their one chance at appeasing their terrible mistress.
Spawn the set-aside The Cult En Masse (Leaderless Fanaticism) at Ritual Clearing.

cards.flavor: Despite the enormity of the woods and the spaces between the trees, navigating the forest is no simple task.  You must trace a path to the ritual site before it's too late.
cards.name: Forest of Giants (v.II)
cards.text: [free] Investigators spend X[per_investigator] clues as a group, where X is 1 less than the number of locations in your row: Flip the facedown Path Forward card beside your row faceup. Objective - After an investigator enters Ritual Clearing, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Unholy Union
cards.text:
Your entrance to the ritual site is met with the towering figure of the Black Goat -- formerly Blake, before his transformation. All showmanship is lost, but it brays hatefully with discordant tones, and the cult advances upon you to defend its master's ritual.
Spawn the set-aside The Cult En Masse (Black Goat's Rapture) at Ritual Clearing.

cards.flavor: Despite the enormity of the woods and the spaces between the trees, navigating the forest is no simple task.  You must trace a path to the ritual site before it's too late.
cards.name: Forest of Giants (v.III)
cards.text: [free] Investigators spend X[per_investigator] clues as a group, where X is 1 less than the number of locations in your row: Flip the facedown Path Forward card beside your row faceup. Objective - After an investigator enters Ritual Clearing, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: One Final Bow
cards.text:
Your entrance to the ritual site is met with much pomp, as Sylvester Blake turns and bows with a sweeping flourish. You are well familiar with his twisted showmanship after your last two encounters with him. "Ladies and gentlemen of the All-Mother, behold our final act! Witness the destined performers playing their parts in the age-old destiny! Can they defy death once more? That, dear friends, is for you to determine!" Blake raises his hands once more as if directing an orchestra, and the cult advances toward you.
Spawn the set-aside The Cult En Masse (Ringmaster's Fervor) at Ritual Clearing.

cards.flavor: The sun and moon approach each other at rapid pace as you fight for control of the clearing.  You must disrupt the ritual before the eclipse begins!
cards.name: Impending Zenith
cards.text: [action] If you are at Ritual Clearing: Reveal 5 random chaos tokens. Investigators as a group at your location may move 1 clue they control to this act, plus 1 additional clue for each token you reveal. Objective - If there are 2[per_investigator] clues on this act, advance.

cards.name: Heavens Above
cards.text:
Not wasting a moment, you pore through the cult paraphernalia to undo the formative spell. With stolen incantations and materials, you break the magic circle, and the eldritch glow begins to fade, just as the edges of the sun and moon touch.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: You have yet to brave the true dangers of the forest.
cards.name: Forgotten Trail
cards.text: Investigators at Forgotten Trail get +1 skill value during tests on encounter cards.

cards.flavor: A lonely path of dirt and bare stone slowly disappears into the foliage.  From here on, you're on your own.
cards.name: Forgotten Trail

cards.flavor:
With each passing second, the moon and sun
draw ever closer to each other.
cards.name: Ritual Clearing
cards.text: [action] Search the chaos bag for a token and seal it on your investigator card: Discover 1 clue from Ritual Clearing.

cards.flavor: Chanting carries on the wind through the forest.  Their ritual has already begun.
cards.name: Ritual Clearing

cards.flavor:
The slanted hill makes close examination difficult,
if not impossible.
cards.name: Foothill Slope
cards.text: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from this location: Lose an action.

cards.flavor:
Slanted as the ground is,
the trees here still grow tall and upright.
cards.name: Foothill Slope

cards.flavor:
It's difficult to find your footing anywhere that
the cult might have traveled here.

The sloped ground is surprisingly useful

The mud surrounding the river is easy to search,
but cold and damp in the early morning.

cards.flavor:
The quiet burbling of a cold water stream both
breaks up the silence and adds to the tension.
cards.name: Mountain Stream

cards.flavor:
The river constantly threatens to
wash away all trace of the cultists.

cards.flavor:
The quiet burbling of a cold water stream both

cards.flavor: The brook is welcome refreshment on this long trek through the California forest.

cards.flavor:
The cold water helps to clear your head
at the very least.

cards.text: [action]: Release a token sealed on your investigator card. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The quiet burbling of a cold water stream both

cards.flavor: There is little to find in this open grove.
cards.name: Open Forest
cards.text: Investigators cannot trigger [free] abilities while investigating at this location.

cards.flavor:
Morning sunlight fills the widely-spaced trees,
but doesn't put you at ease at all.
cards.name: Open Forest

cards.flavor: The sparse trees make it harder to run or hide.
cards.name: Open Forest
cards.text: Investigators cannot trigger [free] abilities while evading at this location.

cards.flavor:

cards.name: Open Forest

cards.flavor: There's not much room for nuance fighting here.
cards.name: Open Forest
cards.text: Investigators cannot trigger [free] abilities while attacking at this location.

Morning sunlight fills the widely-spaced trees,

cards.name: Open Forest

cards.flavor:
It's almost too easy to pick up the trail here.
Is it an ambush?
cards.name: Shadowed Wilderness
cards.text: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from this location, move the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy once toward this location. If no enemy moves via this effect, draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.flavor:
The boughs of these sequoias are thick enough
to partially block the light of the morning sun.

cards.flavor: It's easy to lose the trail in these dense woods.

cards.flavor:
The cultists may feel less need to cover their tracks
in this darker patch of woods.

cards.text: This location gets -1 shroud value while there are 1 or more enemies at this location (-2 shroud value instead if there are any exhausted enemies at this location).

The boughs of these sequoias are thick enough

Path Forward

cards.name: Path Forward

cards.name: Path Forward

cards.name: The Cult En Masse
